revised_title: Reactions of Cyano and Alkyl Cobalamins: Exploring Cobalamin Chemistry
tldr: The authors studied the reactions of cyano and alkyl cobalamins, exploring their chemistry and the effects of electrophilic agents on the cobalamin structure. They found that substitution in the chromophore occurs before the cyclization of the acetamide side chain and suggested that the most reasonable position for this substitution is at C10 of cobalamin.
